I grew up in a rural farming community. When Dad raised chickens he put up a 10 ft fence around them. When chicken hawks swooped in and took chickens, Dad set a few 10 ft posts in the middle of the pen and put wire fencing over it all. No more hawks. If you want to keep the chickens sequestered, put heavy duty fencing over them thar "chickens." stops hawks and drones, not to mention a few helicopters.

replies.context: I raise chickens at $15 each, hawks get the $.20 treatment.
We tried that until cop friend told us it was illegal. Hence, the fence.
